reviews.review_msg: I have never gotten less than a B- on an essay in my life. I got a D on the in class essay. I answered the question and provided a counter argument. And apparently I did that right but she expected more arguments and counter arguments for a 30-minute in class write. She is a super hard marker! In any other class it would have been at least a B.

I sat through every tutorial and learned nothing from her. Stay away from her class as much as possible. She expects all her students to be philosophers when she is not even a philosophy major herself. What's up with that?

Difficult. Does not seem to keep in mind that there are students who have never taken a philosophy class before, and marks them as experienced philosophy students. Does office hours over Skype for one hour once a week, not very accessible.
Prepare to also take FNST101 throughout her courses. Very biased. VERY. Will piss you off unless you like the D. So lazy you have to SKYPE her for office hours.
